definitions.definition: To make a false show or pretence of; to counterfeit or simulate .
examples: The pupil feigned sickness on the day of his exam.
They feigned her signature on the cheque.

definitions.definition: To imagine ; to invent ; to pretend to do something.
examples: He feigned that he had gone home at the appointed time.

definitions.definition: To make an action as if doing one thing, but actually doing another, for example to trick an opponent; to feint .

examples: Jessica feigned the fact that she had not done her homework.

main_definition: To make a false show or pretence of; to counterfeit or simulate .
secondary_definitions: To imagine ; to invent ; to pretend to do something.
To make an action as if doing one thing, but actually doing another, for example to trick an opponent; to feint .
( Can we verify this sense?) To hide or conceal .
